intro: Chondrosum drummondii, commonly known as Drummond's chondrosum, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States and northern Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky soils and arid environments, showcasing adaptations to harsh, dry conditions. Its leaves are usually narrow and gray-green, while its flowers are small and yellow, often appearing in clusters. Chondrosum drummondii is often found in open plains and along canyon walls, where it thrives in full sun.
